doc.after: The 777-200LR ("LR" for Longer Range), the C-market model, became the world's longest-range commercial airliner upon entering service in 2006.[180][181] Boeing named it Worldliner as it could connect almost any two airports in the world,[8] although it remains subject to ETOPS restrictions.[182] It holds the world record for the longest nonstop flight by a commercial airliner,[8] having a maximum range of 9,395 nautical miles (17,400Â km).[89] The -200LR was intended for ultra-long-haul routes such as Los Angeles to Singapore.[77]
